member.name: M:ErrorLogPrioritization.Api.Controllers.DataController.SeedDummyData(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Seed the system with dummy error log data for testing

member.name: M:ErrorLogPrioritization.Api.Controllers.DataController.CheckDataStatus
member.summary: Check if the system has existing log data

member.name: M:ErrorLogPrioritization.Api.Controllers.HealthController.GetHealth
member.summary: Get comprehensive system health status

member.name: M:ErrorLogPrioritization.Api.Controllers.HealthController.GetReadiness
member.summary: Get basic system status for load balancer health checks
member.returns: Simple OK response if system is healthy

member.name: M:ErrorLogPrioritization.Api.Controllers.HealthController.GetLiveness
member.summary: Get basic liveness status for container orchestration
member.returns: Simple OK response if application is alive

member.name: M:ErrorLogPrioritization.Api.Controllers.HealthController.GetSystemInfo
member.summary: Get system information and version details
member.returns: System information including version, environment, and uptime

member.name: M:ErrorLogPrioritization.Api.Controllers.LogController.CollectLogs(System.Collections.Generic.List{ErrorLogPrioritization.Api.Models.ErrorLog})
member.summary: Collect error logs from web applications
member.param: List of error logs to collect
member.remarks:
Sample request:
POST /api/log/collect [ { "id": "unique-log-id-123", "timestamp": "2024-01-15T10:30:00Z", "source": "MyApp.Controllers.UserController", "message": "User authentication failed", "stackTrace": "at UserController.Login() line 45", "severity": "High" } ]

member.name: M:ErrorLogPrioritization.Api.Controllers.LogController.GetLogs(System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieve filtered error logs
member.param: Severity level filter (optional): Critical, High, Medium, Low
Priority level filter (optional): High, Medium, Low
Number of items per page (default: 50, max: 1000)
member.returns: Filtered list of error logs with pagination information

member.name: M:ErrorLogPrioritization.Api.Controllers.LogController.GetLogStatistics(System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Get dashboard statistics for error logs
member.returns: Comprehensive log statistics for dashboard display
member.remarks:
Sample request:
GET /api/log/stats?fromDate=2024-01-01&toDate=2024-01-31
Returns statistics including total logs, severity breakdown, priority distribution, and analysis status.

member.name: M:ErrorLogPrioritization.Api.Controllers.LogController.ExportLogsToExcel(System.String)
member.summary: Export error logs to Excel file for a specific date
member.param: Date for which to export logs (format: yyyy-MM-dd)
member.remarks:
Sample request:
GET /api/log/export/2024-01-15
Downloads an Excel file containing all error logs for the specified date. The file includes columns for timestamp, source, message, severity, priority, and AI analysis results.

member.name: M:ErrorLogPrioritization.Api.Controllers.LogController.ExportLogsToExcelRange(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Export error logs to Excel file for a date range
member.param: End date for export (format: yyyy-MM-dd, optional - defaults to fromDate)
member.remarks:
Sample request:
GET /api/log/export?fromDate=2024-01-01&toDate=2024-01-07
Downloads an Excel file containing all error logs for the specified date range. Maximum date range is 31 days to prevent excessive data exports. The file includes comprehensive log data with AI analysis results.
